text:
OpenAI says the company is on track to unveil its first device in 2H 2026.

That would mark OpenAI‚Äôs first major move from software into dedicated hardware.

10 BIGGEST MOATS IN THE AI ECONOMY

1. $NVDA controls the full-stack AI compute layer from CUDA to Blackwell with 90%+ data center GPU share while inference growth, sovereign AI buildouts & networking attach rates extend the moat beyond training into a recurring enterprise runtime.

2. $PLTR owns the ontology layer that turns messy enterprise data into a shared schema models can reason against with AIP converting pilots into eight-figure production contracts while over 20 years of institutional pattern recognition creates switching costs no competitor can replicate.

3. $TSM operates the only fabs on earth capable of printing 3nm AI silicon at scale with $AAPL, $AMD, $QCOM & $NVDA structurally dependent on capacity that takes years & $40B+ to replicate. 

4. $GOOGL core moat is distribution with the ability to ship new AI capabilities instantly across Search, YouTube, Android & Workspace reaching billions of users & over 350M Gemini MAUs without requiring behavior change.

5. $AMZN runs ~30% of global cloud infrastructure pairing Bedrock‚Äôs model-agnostic inference with Trainium cost advantages & a logistics + retail data flywheel no pure-play cloud provider can match.

6. $META trained AI on 3.4B+ daily active users behavioral data with Llama open-sourcing the model layer to commoditize competitors while Reels, Advantage+ & WhatsApp Business convert engagement into ad revenue ($175B+ annually) no other platform can target as precisely. 

7. $MSFT embedded OpenAI across a productivity stack by monetizing seats through 215M Copilot MAUs, capturing inference workloads in Azure & locking in the developer layer through GitHub as the default AI-native workflow.

8. $ASML builds the only EUV lithography machines capable of printing sub-5nm transistors with a ~$40B backlog, monopoly share in high-NA EUV & an optics supply chain lead no competitor can close this decade.

9. $AAPL controls the device, the distribution & the attention of 2.4B active devices held by high-value users with on-device AI preserving privacy moats while Services revenue compounds at ~13% YoY as the install base monetizes through subscriptions & App Store fees

10. $AVGO supplies the custom AI accelerators & networking silicon connecting GPU clusters with VMware adding software margins & hyperscaler ASIC deals creating recurring design wins independent of $NVDA allocation.

$GOOGL Gemini API calls have more than doubled to 85B with Gemini reaching ~8M subscribers.

Usage and adoption are accelerating as enterprises standardize Gemini across core workflows.

OpenAI shared this chart to show that AI revenue is scaling almost one-for-one with compute. 

Going from ~0.2 GW to ~1.9 GW (~10x increase in power) maps to revenue growing from ~$2B to ~$20B which implies OpenAI is generating ~$10.5B of revenue per GW. 

The really important detail to remember is that OpenAI doesn‚Äôt own this compute but rents it from $MSFT & $ORCL which means every additional GW comes with real margin pressure.

That‚Äôs why this chart reads less like a flex to me and more like a capital pitch since it‚Äôs effectively saying growth requires massive compute expansion and massive compute expansion requires massive funding which helps explain why this is circulating as OpenAI works to line up a ~$1.4T infrastructure buildout.

The CEO of DeepMind says there are never enough chips and global compute is nowhere near meeting AI demand

That‚Äôs why $GOOGL & $AMZN are racing to build their own silicon alongside $NVDA & $AMD with AI scaling toward 5B+ users by 2030.

What matters now is who can produce tokens at the lowest cost per watt.

Microsoft has more cash on hand than any tech company in the world.

This gives it the most flexibility to fund multi-year AI capex & lock in power & infrastructure. 

‚Ä¢ $MSFT +$102B
‚Ä¢ $GOOGL +$98B
‚Ä¢ $AMZN +$94B
‚Ä¢ $NVDA +$61B
‚Ä¢ $AAPL +$55B
‚Ä¢ $META +$44B
‚Ä¢ $TSLA + $42B

Moore‚Äôs Law made computers everywhere in the old economy where the AI‚Äôs version of Moore‚Äôs Law is about making intelligence everywhere. 

Once thinking becomes cheap & abundant then that changes how companies build products, how people work and what software even means. 

That doesn‚Äôt mean SaaS is dead but it forces software to evolve from passive tools into systems that can think and act unlocking capabilities that simply weren‚Äôt possible a few years ago.

Trading with Keltner Channels and ADX together combines trend direction and strength. The Keltner Channel shows price volatility and potential breakout levels, while the ADX (Average Directional Index) measures trend strength.
